devdoc.author: priviprotocol

params.oracleInfo_: the struct with the oracle specifications

initialize(address).details: only owner can initialize, and the ownership is removed after that

params.vault_: the address of the vault contract

owner().details: Returns the address of the current owner.

processResponse(bytes32,uint256).details: function to process the oracle response (only callable from oracle)

params.newOwner_: the address who can retrieve the nft (if 0 assumes is not withdrawable)
params.requestId_: the id of the request to the Chainlink oracle

processResponseForChange(bytes32,bool).details: function to process the oracle response (only callable from oracle)

params.changeable_: the response telling us if this tokens are changeable
params.requestId_: the id of the request to the Chainlink oracle

renounceOwnership().details: Leaves the contract without owner. It will not be possible to call `onlyOwner` functions anymore. Can only be called by the current owner. NOTE: Renouncing ownership will leave the contract without an owner, thereby removing any functionality that is only available to the owner.

transferOwnership(address).details: Transfers ownership of the contract to a new account (`newOwner`). Can only be called by the current owner.

verifyTokenIsChangeable(address,uint256,.details: call to verify if a token is changable in the synthetic collection,      this method can be called only from the nft vault contract

params.collection_: the address of the nft collection
params.tokenFrom_: the id of the nft in the collection to change from
params.tokenTo_: the id of the nft in the collection to change to

returns.requestId: the id of the request to the Chainlink oracle

verifyTokenIsWithdrawable(address,uint25.details: call to verify if a token is withdrawble in the synthetic collection,      this method can be called only from the nft vault contract

params.collection_: the address of the nft collection
params.tokenId_: the id of the nft in the collection

returns.requestId: the id of the request to the Chainlink oracle

devdoc.title: Validator Oracle for withdraws and changes

apiURLForChanges().notice: the API url to check changeable status

apiURLForWithdraws().notice: the API url to check withdrawable status

booleanJobId().notice: the job id for GET -> bool

jobId().notice: the job id for GET -> uint256

linkToken().notice: the address of the LINK token

nodeFee().notice: the node fee required by the Chainlink node

userdoc.notice: use Chainlink API Get request to check if a locked         token is withdrawable or if two locked token are         interchangeable
